trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_00<tab>While being on solid ground has improved Wuk Lamat's mood, her stomach appears to be lagging behind...

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_01<tab>As Erenville prepares to guide you through the city, the suffering Wuk Lamat is approached by a handful of curious Turali. It would seem that the Third Promise's affable nature coupled with a large entourage of unusual outsiders is likely to see you being stopped on every street corner. Thus do you decide to split into two smaller─and hopefully less noticeable─parties. Erenville leaves with the twins in tow, while you and Krile are grouped with Wuk Lamat.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_02<tab>Pushing through her lingering bout of nausea, Wuk Lamat valiantly begins your tour of Tuliyollal with a brief introduction of the harbor. Next stop: Bayside Bevy.
※You must be accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_03<tab>Wuk Lamat introduces you to Tuliyollal's largest marketplace and reassures you that, although the local currency is “pel,” most shopkeepers will readily accept your gil as payment. She then directs you northwards up the stairs towards a certain plaza...
※You must be accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_04<tab>At the plaza, Wuk Lamat explains how Koana brought the knowledge of aetheryte construction back with him from Sharlayan. Seeing the value in the technology at once, the Dawnservant ordered that a crystal be built immediately. After reminding you to complete your attunement, she then urges you onwards to Brightploom Post and the city gate beyond.
※You must be accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_05<tab>You make a stop at Brightploom Post, the headquarters for the Landsguard. Charged with keeping the peace and the defense of the nation, these soldiers are under the direct command of Zoraal Ja, the martially gifted First Promise. Leaving the guardhouse behind, Wuk Lamat shepherds you along to the Xak Tural skygate.
※You must be accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_06<tab>You learn that the imposing skygate opens onto a similarly massive bridge─a Yok Huy construction which enables passage to Xak Tural, the northern landmass of Tural. Those wishing to make the journey require a travel permit, however, which will not be issued until the rite of succession is decided.
※You must be accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile to complete this task. Speak with either of them again should you become separated.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SEQ_07<tab>Krile estimates the tour has taken you around half the city. You rest your feet a moment, with Wuk Lamat seemingly content to wait until you are ready to continue exploring Tuliyollal.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat and have her and Krile accompany you.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_TODO_01<tab>Head to Bayside Bevy while accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile, and speak with Wuk Lamat at the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_TODO_02<tab>Head to the aetheryte plaza while accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile, and speak with Wuk Lamat at the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_TODO_03<tab>Head to Brightploom Post while accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile, and speak with Wuk Lamat at the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_TODO_04<tab>Head to Xak Tural skygate while accompanied by Wuk Lamat and Krile, and speak with Wuk Lamat at the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_TODO_05<tab>Speak with Krile.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_300_001<tab>I wonder what kind of trouble those soldiers are expecting?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ALPHINAUD_200_001<tab>According to Erenville, the Vanu I thought I saw belongs to a clan known as the Hanuhanu. It seems they share more than a physical resemblance.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ALISAIE_100_001<tab>What an amazing city─as lively as Ul'dah, and even more colorful...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_001<tab>I would ask if the journey tired you, but...I'm sure you've endured far worse.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_010<tab>Right, then! First things first...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_011<tab>I...ugh. Still a bit queasy... No more boats for a while...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_012<tab>I realize we've just arrived, but we should get you familiar with the city before the rite of succession begins.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ALPHINAUD_000_013<tab>No arguments here. I should very much like to explore.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_014<tab>Then I'll...guide you...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>Are you sure you're in any condition to do so...?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_XBALAALMALE04861_000_016<tab>Ah hah! We were wondering who these strange folk were. So the Third Promise has found herself some new followers, then!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_017<tab>“Followers”...?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_XBALAALMALE04861_000_018<tab>Wuk Lamat? Are you unwell?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_019<tab>N-No, not at all! Couldn't be better! The Third Promise does <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> get seasick, no sir!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>As for my handpicked entourage here, I've recruited them to help me win the rite of succession. I was about to show them around the city, in fact.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_XBALAALFEMALE04861_000_021<tab>That sounds lovely.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_XBALAALFEMALE04861_000_022<tab>But a group of foreigners is going to attract attention, especially if they're in the company of the Third Promise. Everyone will be curious. We certainly were!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_XBALAALMALE04861_000_023<tab>Your siblings have a tendency to, uh, command a respectful distance. But you─you're just so easy to approach!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_024<tab>And I enjoy it so much when you do. Please, don't ever worry that you're a bother to me.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_XBALAALMALE04861_000_025<tab>You're very kind. Good day to you, Third Promise.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_026<tab>They did have a point.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_027<tab>Wuk Lamat is technically royalty here. Like it or not, a person of her station surrounded by this many outsiders is bound to draw a crowd.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_028<tab>Wait, what do you mean “technically”!?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_029<tab>I suggest we move in two groups so as to attract less attention.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_030<tab>Just “technically” ignoring me, then...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_031<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, you and Krile can come with me.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_032<tab>I'll take the twins, then.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ALPHINAUD_000_033<tab>We'll get in touch once we've had a good look around.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_034<tab>That voyage was hard on all of us, so take it slow and recuperate. We have time enough for that.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_ERENVILLE_000_035<tab>Enjoy your wanderings.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_036<tab>Perhaps we should wait a bit. At least until Wuk Lamat's nausea subsides.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_037<tab>No need for that! Look, I'm ready to go!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_038<tab>...Urgh.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_040<tab>Tuliyollal isn't going anywhere. Let's give Wuk Lamat a little more time.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_050<tab>I'm fine now, really. Can't stand around all day feeling sorry for myself, what with the contest looming and all.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_051<tab>Now, then. Seeing as we're already here, I might as well tell you about the harbor.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_052<tab>Erenville already mentioned the reefs in our coastal waters, which explains why you don't see any big ships moored at the docks.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_053<tab>Only vessels with shallow drafts can navigate the bay─mostly small fishing boats or barges ferrying cargo up and down the rivers from inland settlements.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_054<tab>Much of the incoming traffic is from Yok Tural, the southern landmass. The clans there produce various goods for export.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_055<tab>Their wares are unloaded here and carted off to the merchant stalls in the neighboring markets. Speaking of which, Bayside Bevy should be our next stop.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_056<tab>Wuk Lamat and Krile are now accompanying you. Keep them at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_057<tab>You can leave your quest companions behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with them and selecting the option to part ways.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_058<tab>If you wish to have your companions join you again, return and speak with them at the original location.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_059<tab>While you are accompanied, you may encounter “conversation points” along the way which offer additional topics of discussion.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_060<tab>Enter the glowing area and speak with your quest companions to initiate these bonus conversations. Enjoy exploring your surroundings together!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you do?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A1_000_001<tab>Talk.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A1_000_002<tab>Part ways.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A1_000_003<tab>Nothing.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_061<tab>Tuliyollal is like my own garden─I could lead you around with my eyes closed. If this tour were a ship, it'd be plain sailing all the way!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_062<tab>Urgh... The word “ship” alone is enough to curdle my stomach...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_063<tab>Wandering around this city is so exciting! Unfamiliar wonders everywhere we look!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_064<tab>Are you sure you wish to part ways with your companions?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_065<tab>Did you miss a meal or something? We'll wait for you at the harbor, so hurry back!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_066<tab>Something urgent to attend to? Not to worry, we can meet you at the harbor.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_067<tab>Ah, there you are. Let's get back to it!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_068<tab>Everything all right? Then on with the tour!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_069<tab>This is Bayside Bevy, Tuliyollal's largest marketplace.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_070<tab>Being right on the harbor, everything from fresh fish to imported wares go directly to the shelves. Anything you want, they most likely have.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_071<tab>Oh, right, I should mention that here in Tuliyollal we buy things with “pel,” a currency that the Pelupelu created.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_072<tab>But don't worry! More and more trade is coming in from Eorzea, so most shops are happy to accept your gil.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_073<tab>There's also Wachumeqimeqi, another market to the east of here, but that can wait for another time. I have other places I want to show you first.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_074<tab>Next, we'll head back a bit, then northwards up the stairs to a certain plaza. Hehe, I can't wait to see the look on your faces!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_SYSTEM_000_075<tab>Your companions have yet to arrive. Be sure they are at your side before attempting to continue.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_076<tab>As long as you remember it was invented by the “<var 1A 02 /var>Pel<var 1A 01 /var>upelu,” you'll never forget what our currency is called!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_077<tab>'Tis reassuring to know we can use our gil for shopping here!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_080<tab>What do you think of that, eh?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_081<tab>Goodness me, you have aetherytes in Tuliyollal?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_082<tab>I think I told you before, but my brother, Koana, spent three years studying in Sharlayan.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_083<tab>He fell in love with the nation and its ways, and brought back to us the knowledge of aetheryte construction. Papa warmed to the idea at once─had one built <var 1A 02 /var>immediately<var 1A 01 /var>.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_084<tab>Did you do the “attuning” thing? If you're ready to continue, we'll head down again and then up the slope to the side. Right at the top is the gate which leads to Xak Tural.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_085<tab>Let's make a stop at Brightploom Post on the way, though─that's the headquarters for the Landsguard.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_086<tab>Make sure you attune to the aetheryte! I don't fully understand how it works, but I do know you'll regret it if you forget.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_087<tab>Thank goodness for aetherytes. Though I don't share Wuk Lamat's dislike of ships, I'm not especially eager to make that voyage again...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A2_000_001<tab><var 48 F20224 /var>Discuss Tuliyollal's elevation.<var 48 01 /var>

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_091<tab>We have a lot of narrow, winding streets that crawl up the sides of the mountain. As you can see, though, the builders made sure the city's main thoroughfares were wide enough to accommodate wagons.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_092<tab>Trudging up and down all these slopes and stairs is exhausting. I understand now where Wuk Lamat gets her endless endurance.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_093<tab>Here we are─Brightploom Post. The soldiers stationed here are responsible for defending Tuliyollal and preserving the peace.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_094<tab>The Landsguard are led by our nation's strongest warrior, and so naturally Papa has commanded them since the beginning.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_095<tab>...At least until three years ago, when Zoraal Ja took over as commander. The title is no empty honor─it means the First Promise is considered equal to the Dawnservant in martial strength.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_096<tab>Meanwhile, I haven't even managed to...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_097<tab>Well, I'll discuss my brothers and their accomplishments later. Alphinaud and Alisaie should be around to hear it, too.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_098<tab>Come on, it's time I showed you the skygate. It's right at the northern end of Talonmarch!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_099<tab>If I'm to succeed Papa, then it's my brothers I need to surpass first...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_100_099<tab>Zoraal Ja─that's clearly a Mamool Ja name. An interesting family.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_100<tab>Massive, isn't it?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_101<tab>And on the other side is an equally massive bridge to match. Both were constructed by a race of giants─the Yok Huy.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_102<tab>Strictly speaking, Tural is actually two separate continents: Yok Tural, the southern lands of the Mother; and Xak Tural, the northern lands of the Father, which lie beyond the bridge.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_103<tab>Legends say it used to be one great landmass. But long, long ago, the two gods fought a titanic battle, and when one threw the other to the ground, the impact was so devastating as to split the continent in twain.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_104<tab>A familiar-sounding tale... I am put in mind of the conflict between Hydaelyn and Zodiark.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_105<tab>But getting back to Xak Tural. Those lands are also part of the Tuliyollal nation, correct?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_106<tab>That's right. Isn't my father incredible? He united the peoples of two continents into a single nation.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_107<tab>The many clans of Tural had been at war for generations. It was only when Papa traveled the lands and put a stop to their myriad conflicts that we finally had peace.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_108<tab>And that's the main reason I want to win the throne: so I can preserve the peace he built.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_109<tab>...But I see you're more interested in what's behind the gate than hearing about my aspirations.

TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_110<tab>Crossing the bridge to Xak Tural requires a special travel pass. Unfortunately, they won't issue any new permits until the rite of succession is over. I promise to get you one when I'm Dawnservant, but until then...you'll just have to wait!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_Q3_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A3_000_001<tab>I'll hold you to that.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A3_000_002<tab>Then I'll make sure you win─mark my words!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_A3_000_003<tab>I wish we could go there right now...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_112<tab>I've never broken my word! Once the throne is mine, that travel permit is yours!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_113<tab>You really mean that... Heh, woe to anyone who stands between you and adventure!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_114<tab>Be patient. I swear that once the throne is mine, that travel permit is yours.
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_WUKLAMAT_000_120<tab>Tired from all this walking? Take a moment to rest, and we'll continue the tour!
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_130<tab>We must have covered half the city by now...
TEXT_KINGMA102_04861_KRILE_000_131<tab>Tuliyollal is unlike any other place I've visited. I'm thoroughly enjoying myself!
